intro: Plagiobothrys orthocarpus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal dunes. Plagiobothrys orthocarpus is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
